item.title: Kevin add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Deep in each man is the knowledge that something knows of his existence. Something knows, and cannot be fled nor hid from." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Kevin add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "We want to believe. Young students try to believe in older authors, constituents try to believe in their Congressmen, countries try to believe in their statesmen, but they can't. Too many voices, too much scattered, illogical ill-considered criticism." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Kevin add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Here was a new generation, shouting the old cries, learning the old creeds, through a revery of long days and nights; destined finally to go out into that dirty gray turmoil to follow love and pride; a new generation dedicated more than the last to the fear of poverty and the worship of success; grown up to find all Gods dead, all wars fought, all faiths in man shaken..." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Raymond Carver
item.description: "That was in Crescent City, California, up near the Oregon border. I left soon after. But today I was thinking of that place, of Crescent City, and of how I was trying out a new life there with my wife, and how, in the barber's chair that morning, I had made up my mind to go. I was thinking today about the calm I felt when I closed my eyes and let the barber's fingers move through my hair, the sweetness of those fingers, the hair already starting to grow." -- Raymond Carver

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Raymond Carver
item.description: "But he stays by the window, remembering that life. They had laughed. They had leaned on each other and laughed until the tears had come, while everything else—the cold and where he'd go in it—was outside, for a while anyway." -- Raymond Carver

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "They were watching, out there past men's knowing, where stars are drowning and whales ferry their vast souls through the black and seamless sea." -- Cormac McCarthy
